clues.text: In the 1970s this Texas governor served in the U.S. Air Force flying C-130 tactical airlift aircraft
This Californian has served as governor on 2 occasions, both times succeeding an actor
On Oct. 4, 2011 this N.J. governor announced he wasn't running for president, saying, "Now is not my time"
This New York governor is the son of a former governor of the state
Born with the Indian name Piyush, this Louisiana governor wanted to be called Bobby after Bobby on "The Brady Bunch"
Magnesium is an essential component of this green pigment that's found in almost every plant
It makes up about 11% of the weight of water
Martin Klaproth discovered this element in 1789 & named it for a discovery of 1781
Some studies say lozenges of this element, atomic number 30, help ease the severity of colds
Chemist Carl Scheele named the gas that bleached flowers dephlogisticated muriatic acid; we call it this element
"I knew you were" this "when you walked in"
Naming names, Taylor dated this wolf portrayer in 2009
Taylor's "colorful" fourth studio album
Ms. Swift was named for this "Fire And Rain" singer
"Someday I'll be living in a big old city, & all you're ever gonna be is" this
Pikes Peak
The Matterhorn, aka Monte Cervino
Mount Rainier & Mount Hood
Mount Tupungato & Mount Mercedario
K2 (it's what the "K" stands for)
A.M. comes from the Latin words "ante meridiem", meaning "before" this
One of these is used to tell time by the shadow that its gnomon casts on a calibrated ring
It's what the U.S. Naval Observatory calls a timepiece regulated by the natural vibration frequencies of cesium particles
The word "clock" derives from a French word for this object that could be used to sound the time
Smartphone clocks can drift 10 sec. a day; a Hong Kong scientist has a way to sync them with the flickering of this kind of light
Medicine in the "Star Trek" world involves a "laser" one of these surgical instruments
A leather strip called a strop is traditionally for sharpening this
In Islamic tradition Zulfikar, one of these, passed to the caliph Ali on Muhammad's death
The company Festool introduced a gas-powered one of these tools in the 1920s
To have a selfish motive, or to possess an implement that needs sharpening

rounds.comments: (Alex: Those three letters will come up in that order in each correct response.)

clues.text: Similarity in appearance; I see the...
To accept a concept willingly; hug it out!
To board a ship, or to start an enterprise
A thin layer of body tissue lining an organ
Type of "organization" that encompasses a number of smaller groups
Because Mount Kenya is right on this line, climbers prefer the north side July-Sept. or the south side Dec.-Feb.
120 years ago what's now Nairobi was this, an oasis for thirsty animals (&, informally, thirsty people)
Birders love "soda lakes" like Nakuru: the alkaline water supports the blue-green type of these, luring lots of flamingos
Some of Kenya's most fertile land is within this 4,000-mile-long "great" depression
She was talking about West Kenya when she began a book, "I had a farm in Africa, at the foot of the Ngong Hills"
On Kanye's "nodisrespecttobenaffleck" hashtag, this woman, "alias" Ben's wife, noted, "I say that all the time"
A tag line for this Affleck film was "The movie was fake.  The mission was real"
Ben doesn't have much to say on the market economy in the colonies in a bar scene in this 1997 film... but Matt Damon does
As Ned, Ben agrees to play Mercutio in this film but does have an irritated question for the play's author... "He dies?"
An armored car robbery goes wrong in "The Town" for Ben & this actor; maybe a bow & arrow would've helped?
In March 2014 NYC's 92nd Street Y will use a 7-day program to define this (our try: a creatively brilliant person)
stopTHIS.gov defines it as "unwanted, aggressive behavior among... children that involves a... power imbalance"
The elusive concept of fairness, or an official "of the peace"
AKA po-mo, it's a rejection of theory in favor of a mix of styles & values--or something like that
Clara Bow starred in a 1927 film whose title was this pronoun--hard to define, but basically sex appeal
Despite the inconvenience of being killed in a movie, Phil Coulson made it to the small screen as an "Agent of" this

Phil Dunphy, on this sitcom:
"I'm the cool dad... I'm hip, I surf the web, I text... LOL... OMG... WTF, why the face?"
Ichabod Crane napped for 2 centuries, but at least he awoke with his head still atop his shoulders on this drama
Spoiler alert!  In 2013, via a governor's veto, Hershel lost another important body part on this AMC show
"American Horror Story" turned its attention to witches in its 2013 season, titled this
In 1886 this poet said, "I must go in, for the fog is rising"--then death stopped for her
At Trafalgar he reportedly said, "Thank God I have done my duty" & then expired
A final manifesto attributed to him in 1883 was "Last words are for fools who haven't said enough"
This Spanish artist passed away in 1973 but not before asking friends to "Drink to me"
Concerned about his mistress Nell Gwynn, this restoration king requested, "Let not poor Nelly starve"

rounds.text: 230 miles long, it defined a boundary between a colony founded by Quakers & one founded by Catholics
